abstract: George Vecsey Sports of The Times column on United States national soccer team coach Jurgen Klinsmann, who played for several prominent clubs in Europe and helped West Germany win 1990 World Cup title; holds that sometimes superstars work out as coaches and other times they do not.
snippet: A world-class star coaching United States soccer is an interesting experiment, but after five games it is not clear what kind of coach Jurgen Klinsmann is.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Men's National Soccer Team

lead_paragraph: A world-class star coaching United States soccer is an interesting experiment, but after five games it is not clear what kind of coach Jurgen Klinsmann is.

headline.main: U.S. Coach Doesn’t Play the Superstar Card
headline.print_headline: U.S. Coach Doesn’t Play the Superstar Card
headline.seo: U.S. Soccer Coach Keeps Approach Positive and Open
